discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
@strub thanks! 
@bgregoir what are the lemmas you usually have about `all2`?

discussion.author: bgregoir
discussion.comment:
I think that the lemma all2P (of the pull request) is the only one needed.
Most of the time, proof is done by induction and the only important part is the fact that all2 simplify.
B

discussion.author: gares
discussion.comment: I imagine we also want `Arguments all2 {T U} p !s1 !s2.` so that it unfolds only when *both* lists are concrete.

discussion.author: amahboubi
discussion.comment: Hi, I do not understand why we need the fixpoint at all. I would have defined `all2` as the right hand-side of `all2E`.

discussion.author: bgregoir
discussion.comment:
> Le 10 sept. 2018 à 15:21, Assia Mahboubi <notifications@github.com> a écrit :
> 
> Hi, I do not understand why we need the fixpoint at all. I would have defined all2 as the right hand-side of all2E.
> 
> 
    The computation behaviour of the  right hand-side is not very good.
B

discussion.author: strub
discussion.comment: Because the right hand side of allE has a bad behaviour w.r.t. reduction. @bgregoir may have more insights about this.

discussion.author: amahboubi
discussion.comment: @bgregoir, can you give an example of behaviour you do not like?

discussion.author: bgregoir
discussion.comment:
Reduction of all2 f (a::b) (c::d) —> f a c && all2 f b d

> Le 10 sept. 2018 à 15:31, Assia Mahboubi <notifications@github.com> a écrit :
> 
> @bgregoir <https://github.com/bgregoir>, can you give an example of behaviour you do not like?

>

discussion.author: bgregoir
discussion.comment:
Maybe my last email is not very clear.

> Reduction of all2 f (a::b) (c::d) —> f a c && all2 f b d

This is a reduction that I like that we do not have using zip and length.
We can add the rewriting rule, but it will not be reduction.
B

discussion.author: amahboubi
discussion.comment: Sure, this is where the two definitions differ. You certainly know best, as you have been the one using it. However, I guess that we should consider including a minimal theory, if we include this definition in `seq`. At least fixpoint equations, but may be also connections with `allpairs`, `cat`, `subseq`,etc. I do not want to block the merge though.

discussion.author: amahboubi
discussion.comment:
I do not know what to do here:
- github tells me this PR now has conflicts
- I do not think the change is worth 7 commits.

Can you at least squash?

discussion.author: strub
discussion.comment: I can resolve the conflicts. If I understand well, this is then up to you to squash the commit by choosing the correct merge option.

discussion.author: amahboubi
discussion.comment:

which is apparently not set for math-comp.

discussion.author: amahboubi
discussion.comment: Yes, it is set, sorry: I just did not realize I had access to a menu for merging pull requests. I will merge as soon as travis is ok with it.

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: Wouldn't `all2E` be a better name? (since it is not an equivalence but an elimination equation)

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: And how about factoring `T U p` as a section context and have `all2E` stated on two line instead of three?

review_discussion.author: amahboubi
review_discussion.comment: The final `eqSS` is useless, as `by` will perform the conversion job.
